channel.title: INtopBackup
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from INtopBackup, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: BBC finds Syrian families sheltering at Russian airbase from sectarian attacks
item.description: Many belong to former President Bashar al-Assad's sect, which was targeted in mass killings.

item.title: Florence and Pisa on alert as flooding hits Italy
item.description: Tuscany's president advises residents to exercise "the utmost attention and caution".

item.title: The best and biggest games of 2025 so far
item.description: Game studios have cranked out surprising hits ranging from cooperative platformers to historical epics. NPR staff and contributors round up the latest...

item.title: Senate signals plans to avoid shutdown. And, Trump to visit DOJ
item.description: Senate Democrats must choose between a government shutdown or a bill they hate, as the deadline to pass a spending bill looms.

item.title: Slain Iowa mom documented fears of estranged husband on sticky notes
item.description: Angela Prichard was shot and killed by her estranged husband in October 2022. Her sister, Wendy Budde, tells "48 Hours" correspondent Jonathan Vigliot...

item.title: Once-routine immigration check-ins become high-stakes calculation as some are detained
Mark Carney to be sworn in as new Canadian prime minister
item.description: The economist and political newcomer takes office just days after being elected Liberal leader.

item.title: British man killed by president's convoy in Kenya hit-and-run
item.description: The car did not stop after hitting Edgar Charles Frederick, 79, on a road in the capital, Nairobi.

item.title: Guinness sees a surge in U.S. popularity ahead of St. Patrick's Day
item.description: As Dublin prepares for St. Patrick's Day celebrations, Guinness — a staple of the holiday — continues to grow in popularity in the U.S. Ed O'Keefe vis...

item.title: Are beef tallow fries any healthier? These nutritionists say don't kid yourself
item.description: In a recent appearance on Fox News, Robert F. Kennedy Jr. ate French fries cooked in beef tallow and mused that 'food is medicine.' Nutrition scientis...

item.title: What to know after Schumer says he'll vote for GOP bill to avert government shutdown
item.description: Just a day after saying Republicans didn't have the votes to pass their continuing resolution, Senate Minority Leader Chuck Schumer says he'll vote to...

item.title: Russian sentenced to life for war crimes in Ukraine
item.description: Voislav Torden, of Russian far-right mercenary group Rusich, was found guilty of charges relating to an ambush which killed 22.

item.title: Werner Herzog | Sunday on 60 Minutes
item.description: The name Werner Herzog may not be as recognizable as Steven Spielberg or Martin Scorsese, but over the last six decades, the German filmmaker has had ...

item.title: USPS agrees to work with DOGE on reform, planning to cut 10,000 workers
Hamas says it's willing to release the five American hostages in Gaza
item.description: Hamas, the militant group the U.S. has labeled as terrorists, says it's willing to release the one living American hostage and bodies of four others i...

item.title: Details on Trump's threat of 200% tariff on alcohol from European Union
item.description: The Dow lost more than 500 points Thursday and the Nasdaq dropped more than 300 as investors reacted to President Trump's threat to impose a 200% tari...

item.title: Big March storm system threatens US with tornadoes, blizzards and wildfire risk
item.description: A sweeping storm system moving across the U.S. threatens to bring tornadoes, blizzards and possibly wildfires to different regions of the country.

item.title: Dorothy Thompson: The journalist who warned us about Hitler
